concept.title: Manage the Orchestration of Jobs
concept.shortdesc: In , pipelines are the design of the dataflow. Jobs are the execution of the dataflow. Data engineers design pipelines on an authoring . DevOps or site reliability engineers run jobs on groups of execution s.

conbody.p: As a DevOps or site reliability engineer - the person responsible for ensuring that all services and systems are scalable and reliable - you register both authoring and execution s with . You register s by manually administering them or by automatically provisioning them on a container orchestration framework such as Kubernetes. All registered s - either manually administered or automatically provisioned - function in the same way.

You create jobs to run pipelines on groups of execution s. When you start a job on a group of s,
remotely runs the pipeline on the s in the group. This enables you to manage and orchestrate large scale dataflows run across multiple s.

You might organize jobs by project, geographic region, or department. For example, your data engineer has developed and published the WebLog Collection pipeline and the EDW Replication Flows pipeline. In your data center, you designate s that run on several of the servers as the web server group. You designate another group of s running on other servers as the data warehouse group. You then create a job to run the WebLog Collection pipeline on the group of web server s.

The following image displays how the WebLog Collection job runs a remote pipeline instance on each in the web server group. The job does not run pipelines on s in the data warehouse group, which are s that are reserved for pipelines that read from the enterprise data warehouse.
